data.title: Atom 0.208 won't open files larger than 2MB
data.body:
The [Release Notes page](https://atom.io/releases) says that now Atom can open files larger than 2MB, but for some reason, Atom 0.208 behaves exactly as 0.207, and displays the same yellow message when trying to open files larger than 2MB.
My OS is Ubuntu 14.04

data.title: Open files not from Tree View in preview tabs
data.body: Can you make it so that files also get opened in preview tabs when you open them from the Open dialog?

data.title: Plugin tooltips API change - was this intentional?
data.body:
Hi,

Recently, the tooltips for types in both the **atom-typescript** and **omnisharp-atom** plugins broke simultaneously.  In recent versions of atom, regardless of where the scroll position was in the file, the tooltips displayed by these plugins would be appropriate for what appeared at the top and leftmost "screenfull" of the file based on the mouse position.

For example:

![ExampleBadTooltip](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3755379/8022613/7f25bd5e-0cab-11e5-9501-e2e20f23ef11.png)

The `ICompilePromise` tooltip was appropriate for that x position on line 17 of the file - not line 207.

We reported it here: https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/issues/381 and came up with this fix: https://github.com/TypeStrong/atom-typescript/pull/384 which was adding these two lines in the code that determines the mouse position:

``` js
pixelPt.top += editor.displayBuffer.getScrollTop();
pixelPt.left += editor.displayBuffer.getScrollLeft();
```

These tooltips had been working correctly up until perhaps a week or two ago.  I suspect this was due to some sort of change in Atom to the output of `getBoundingClientRect()`, or `editor.screenPositionForPixelPosition()`, or `editor.bufferPositionForScreenPosition()`.

My questions are - do you believe that this is correct, and if so, was this intentional?  Do you think this new behavior will stand or is it a bug?  To my knowledge atom-typescript didn't have any calls that were marked as deprecated prior to this bug emerging.

I looked through the recent patch notes and didn't see anything that sounds like it should have caused this problem.  Thanks.

data.title: Delete partially off-screen markers which are empty
Atom under Windows keeps lagging
data.body:
Hi,

first, great changes so far... but after the upgrade to v2.0 it keeps on lagging for me as a Windows user. Especially when I click on a Package in my list or just go right to the settings.

Before Atom worked completly fine. Something is broken.

data.title: Package installer search field broken
data.body: In the "Install" tab under "Settings", the search box is no longer searching when the enter key is pressed.  In order to search I have to click on the inactive button in the button group with "Packages/Themes", then click back to the category that I actually want to search.  I'm on a new MacBook running OS X 10.10 with Atom v0.206.0.

data.title: Calling dialog.showOpenDialog() throws error processing argument 2
data.body:
I have tried everything. Adding all needed arguments. Removing all arguments. Supplying only some of the arguments. Passing different options. Always the same error. Tried under Windows and Mac. Running the code from the renderer process and requiring dialog using `remote.require('dialog');`. The exact same approach works perfectly for `showSaveDialog`.

``` javascript
// I have tried supplying the currently focused window, removing the function, changing the options
dialog.showOpenDialog({
  title: 'Open a file',
  properties: ['openFile'],
  filters: [
    { name: 'Markdown', extensions: ['md'] },
    { name: 'Text', extensions: 'txt' }
  ]
}, function () {});
```

The error is always:

```
[8548:0609/210137:INFO:CONSOLE(77)] "Uncaught Error: Error processing argument 2.
TypeError: Error processing argument 2.
    at TypeError (native)
    at Object.module.exports.showOpenDialog (C:\Users\anton_000\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\electron-prebuilt\dist\
resources\atom.asar\browser\api\lib\dialog.js:80:22)
    at callFunction (C:\Users\anton_000\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\electron-prebuilt\dist\resources\atom.asar\brow
ser\lib\rpc-server.js:116:18)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (C:\Users\anton_000\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\electron-prebuilt\dist\resources\at
om.asar\browser\lib\rpc-server.js:212:14)
    at emitMany (events.js:108:13)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:179:7)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (C:\Users\anton_000\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\electron-prebuilt\dist\resources\at
om.asar\browser\api\lib\web-contents.js:96:23)
    at emitTwo (events.js:87:13)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:169:7)", source: C:\Users\anton_000\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\electron-prebui
lt\dist\resources\atom.asar\renderer\api\lib\remote.js (77)
```

data.title: Atom doesn't respect saved session if opened with file arguments
data.body:
If Atom opens without arguments, it restores session with all tabs and project folders. If launch Atom with file arguments (via terminal or shorctut association) and it's already opened, it only opens a new tab for file and keeps current project folders and other tabs.
But if launch Atom with file arguments and no other instance is opened, all saved session becomes lost, it changes project folder to file's root and opens only one tab for executed file.
For example, Sublime respects saved session in that case too.

Arch Linux x64, Atom 1.0.10 x64.

data.title: ctrl-0 conflicts on Windows and cannot reset font size
data.body:
When I hit `ctrl-0` in an editor pane, I expect the font-size to reset. Instead, the tree view focus is toggled. The `ctrl-=` and `ctrl--` keystrokes both work to increase and decrease the font size, and `ctrl-0` is listed under the "View" toolbar menu as being the appropriate keyboard shortcut for resetting font size.

There are no errors in the Developer Tools. The issue appears simply to be a keystroke conflict. For `.platform-win32, .platform-linux`, `ctrl-0` toggles tree view as well as resets font size, and tree view toggle apparently wins.

I'm using Windows 8.1 and Atom 0.207.0.

data.title: Creating Custom Theme Question - Not Issue
data.body:
There is a theme I use in Brackets that I love, however I prefer to use Atom over Brackets.

What is the easiest way to convert that over? I don't seem to 100% the mark-up of both. Obviously they will have different syntax, so I'm not sure what's the best way to try and convert it.

Any suggestions, please?

data.title: Preview tabs don't stay open when double clicked
data.body: With the new preview tabs, there's currently not a way to keep a tab opened without making changes to the file's contents. In sublime, double clicking a file prevents the preview from being closed when switching to another file. This would be useful behaviour in atom's preview tabs as well.

data.title: Fix inconsistency with pane resize cursors.
data.body:
Resolves inconsistency as raised by https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7178 and originally raised by  @trkoch in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5902#issuecomment-95063910. Updates the pane resize cursor to leverage col-resize for horizontal and row-resize for vertically split panes.

Cursor Reference: 
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

Screen Capture showing fix:
![atomresizepanecursorfix](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/119151/8053335/905e84d0-0e44-11e5-812d-0d26fda05ab5.gif)

data.title: Resize pane cursor is inconsistent with tree view cursor
data.body:
As noted by @trkoch in the https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/5902#issuecomment-95063910 thread, the resize pane cursor is inconsistent with the resize cursor. Specifically the tree view cursor uses the col-resize cursor where the resize panes use the ew-resize for horizontal and ns-resize for vertically split panes. This should be updated to using the split panes leverage col-resize cursor for horizontal and row-resize for vertically split panes.

The following screen capture highlights the issue:
![atomresizepanecursorbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/119151/8053169/e7d78bbe-0e42-11e5-9048-00cccbd61ca8.gif)

data.title: Only use package directory name as fallback
data.body:
Fixes #7174

/cc @kevinsawicki

data.title: Correct isMaximixed misspelling to isMaximized
data.body: Was bothering me a little. Deprecate old misspelled API, removing from docs.

data.title: Enable/disable depends on package directory name, not `name` from package.json
data.body:
We have some packages whose directory names do not correspond to their package name (e.g. `nuclide/file-tree` for `nuclide-file-tree`, `nuclide/hack` for `nuclide-hack`), and I noticed that the Package Manager (i.e. Settings > Packages) doesn't allow me to enable/disable them.

I looked at `~/.atom/config.cson`, and it seems like just the base name of the directory is being written into the `core.disabledPackages` config. I believe it needs to be the `name` field from the `package.json` for it to work properly.

data.title: Show a warning prompt when opening files over 20MB
data.body:
![screenshot 2015-06-08 23 52 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1789/8046221/79c32c68-0e39-11e5-8ea2-76fc21e68880.png)

I'm now considering chunking the population of the line index on the UI thread to get us a progress bar before 1.0. I want to fix some bugs first, so until then, this will represent a soft limit to keep people from straying into the danger zone with larger files.

data.title: Don’t break out soft tabs that are interrupted by a scope boundary
data.body: Fixes #7160

data.title: New file command does nothing with no windows open
data.body: I'm running Atom 0.207 on Mac. I ran into a weird scenario today where hitting cmd-n and clicking "File -> New File" did absolutely nothing. Unfortunately, I'm not sure exactly what caused this. I was adding and renaming folders and maybe using Git Plus a little bit but that's all. Anyways, here's a gif of the behavior: http://g.recordit.co/njk9NwI6M8.gif.

data.title: Fixed missing icon when building from source
data.body:
When building from source there is a problem with the `atom.desktop`. The icon that it points to doesn't exit.
I added `atom.png` to get unpacked from app.asar and changed `atom.desktop` to point to and fixed the problem

data.title: Update Project::getRepositories() example
data.body: The example was using a `project` global instead of `atom.project`.

data.title: Project Tree Erased
data.body:
The project tree gets erased and replaced with the containing folder when you select "Open in Atom" from the right click menu when right clicking on a file. This is happening on Windows 7 with 0.207.0 .

Steps for reproduction:
1. Add several project folders to the tree view.
2. Close down Atom.
3. In a file explorer, right click a file and select "Open in Atom".
4. All of the projects you added before to the tree are removed, leaving only the containing folder of the file you just opened.
5. Close down Atom.
6. On reopening atom, the project tree still only contains the folder present in step 4.

data.title: Ending HTML comments in 3 dashes breaks highlight
data.body:
I have the following piece of snippet:

``` html
<html>
  <body>
    <!-- some comment --->
  </body>
</html>
```

As you can see even in GitHub (like GitHub is being developed by the same guys as Atom :grin: ) the `body` and `html` appear commented, although they really aren't, because of the extra dash in the comment.

Chrome doesn't complain about this. Are there any browsers that do or why do you guys parse it like this ?

data.title: Atom refocuses the application while starting
data.body:
I noticed this morning, that on OS X, Atom refocuses the application while starting up.

This means that if I CMD+TAB to another application while waiting for Atom to launch, Atom immediately grabs the focus back again.

And if I CMD+TAB again, Atom keeps grabbing it back again.

It would be great if these startup issues could be fixed quickly, especially the issue with Atom opening an untitled window all the time.
